subject: Science
title: Alfred Wegener's Wild Idea
description: A fast breakdown of Alfred Wegener's Wild Idea for builders.

hook.text: In 1912, a meteorologist noticed South America and Africa fit together like puzzle pieces.

buildup.text: Alfred Wegener proposed all continents were once joined in a supercontinent: Pangaea.

discovery.text: He found matching fossils and rock types on continents separated by oceans.

twist.text: Geologists mocked him. He couldn't explain how continents moved. He died in disgrace.

climax.text: Decades later, seafloor mapping proved him right â€” the ocean floor was spreading.

punchline.text: Wegener was right about everything except the mechanism. That cost him.
